001package edu.pdx.cs410J;
002
003import java.lang.reflect.Field;
004import java.lang.reflect.Method;
005import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
006import java.io.PrintStream;
007import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
008import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
009import java.security.Permission;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011import java.util.List;
012
013/**
014 * The superclass of test classes that invoke a main method to test a Java program.
015 *
016 * @author David Whitlock
017 * @since Summer 2010
018 */
019public abstract class InvokeMainTestCase
020{
021    /**
022     * Invokes the <code>main</code> method of the given class with the given arguments and returns an object
023     * that represents the result of invoking that method.
024     * @param mainClass The class whose main method is invoked
025     * @param args The arguments passed to the main method
026     * @return The result of the method invocation
027     */
028    protected MainMethodResult invokeMain( Class<?> mainClass, String... args )
029    {
030        return new MainMethodResult(mainClass, args).invoke(false);
031    }
032
033    /**
034     * Invokes the <code>main</code> method of the given class with the given arguments and returns an object
035     * that represents the result of invoking that method.
036     *
037     * This method will not throw a {@link MainClassContainsMutableStaticFields} exception
038     * if the <code>mainClass</code> has mutable <code>static</code> fields.
039     *
040     * @param mainClass The class whose main method is invoked
041     * @param args The arguments passed to the main method
042     * @return The result of the method invocation
043     */
044    protected MainMethodResult invokeMainAllowingMutableStaticFields( Class<?> mainClass, String... args )
045    {
046        return new MainMethodResult(mainClass, args).invoke(true);
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Invokes the <code>main</code> method of a class and captures information about the invocation such as the data
051     * written to standard out and standard error and the exit code.
052     */
053    protected static class MainMethodResult
054    {
055        private final Class<?> mainClass;
056        private final String[] args;
057        private Integer exitCode;
058        private String out;
059        private String err;
060
061        MainMethodResult( Class<?> mainClass, String[] args )
062        {
063            this.mainClass = mainClass;
064            this.args = args;
065        }
066
067        /**
068         * Invokes the main method
069         * @return This <code>MainMethodResult</code>
070         */
071        public MainMethodResult invoke(boolean allowMutableStaticFields)
072        {
073            Method main;
074            try
075            {
076                main = mainClass.getMethod("main", String[].class);
077            }
078            catch ( NoSuchMethodException e )
079            {
080                throw new IllegalArgumentException( "Class " + mainClass.getName() + " does not have a main method" );
081            }
082
083            if (!allowMutableStaticFields) {
084                checkForMutableStaticFields();
085            }
086
087            try
088            {
089                invokeMain( main );
090            }
091            catch ( IllegalAccessException e )
092            {
093                throw new IllegalArgumentException( "Cannot invoke main method of " + mainClass.getName(), e);
094            }
095            catch ( InvocationTargetException e )
096            {
097                throw new UncaughtExceptionInMain(e.getCause());
098            }
099            return this;
100        }
101
102        private void checkForMutableStaticFields() {
103            List<String> mutableStaticFieldNames = new ArrayList<>();
104            for (Field field : mainClass.getDeclaredFields()) {
105                int modifiers = field.getModifiers();
106                if (Modifier.isStatic(modifiers) && !Modifier.isFinal(modifiers)) {
107                    mutableStaticFieldNames.add(field.getName());
108                }
109            }
110
111            if (!mutableStaticFieldNames.isEmpty()) {
112                throw new MainClassContainsMutableStaticFields(mainClass.getName(), mutableStaticFieldNames);
113            }
114
115        }
116
117        private void invokeMain( Method main )
118            throws IllegalAccessException, InvocationTargetException
119        {
120            SecurityManager oldSecurityManager = System.getSecurityManager();
121            PrintStream oldOut = System.out;
122            PrintStream oldErr = System.err;
123            try {
124                MainMethodResult.ExitStatusSecurityManager essm = new ExitStatusSecurityManager(oldSecurityManager);
125                System.setSecurityManager( essm );
126
127                ByteArrayOutputStream newOut = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
128                ByteArrayOutputStream newErr = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
129                System.setOut( new PrintStream(newOut) );
130                System.setErr( new PrintStream(newErr) );
131
132                try {
133                    main.invoke( null, (Object) copyOfArgs());
134
135                } catch ( InvocationTargetException ex ) {
136                    if ( ex.getCause() instanceof ExitException ) {
137                        this.exitCode = ((ExitException) ex.getCause()).getExitCode();
138
139                    } else {
140                        throw ex;
141                    }
142                }
143
144                this.out = newOut.toString();
145                this.err = newErr.toString();
146
147            } finally {
148                System.setSecurityManager( oldSecurityManager );
149                System.setOut( oldOut );
150                System.setErr( oldErr );
151            }
152        }
153
154        @SuppressWarnings("StringOperationCanBeSimplified")
155        private String[] copyOfArgs() {
156            String[] copy = new String[this.args.length];
157            String[] strings = this.args;
158            for (int i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
159                String arg = strings[i];
160                copy[i] = new String(arg);
161            }
162            return copy;
163        }
164
165        /**
166         * Returns the exit code of this program (the argument to {@link System#exit(int)}
167         * @return <code>null</code> if {@link System#exit(int)} was not invoked
168         */
169        public Integer getExitCode()
170        {
171            return this.exitCode;
172        }
173
174        /**
175         * Returns the data written to standard out
176         * @return the data written to standard out
177         */
178        public String getTextWrittenToStandardOut()
179        {
180            return out;
181        }
182
183        /**
184         * Returns the data written to standard err
185         * @return the data written to standard err
186         */
187        public String getTextWrittenToStandardError()
188        {
189            return err;
190        }
191
192        /**
193         * A {@link SecurityManager} that delegates security checks to another {@link SecurityManager}, but captures
194         * the exit code called by {@link System#exit(int)}
195         */
196        private static class ExitStatusSecurityManager extends SecurityManager
197        {
198            private final SecurityManager delegate;
199
200            public ExitStatusSecurityManager( SecurityManager manager )
201            {
202                this.delegate = manager;
203            }
204
205            @Override
206            public void checkPermission( Permission perm )
207            {
208                if (this.delegate != null) {
209                    this.delegate.checkPermission( perm );
210                }
211            }
212
213            @Override
214            public void checkPermission( Permission perm, Object context )
215            {
216                if (this.delegate != null) {
217                    this.delegate.checkPermission( perm, context );
218                }
219            }
220
221            @Override
222            public void checkExit( int status )
223            {
224                if (this.delegate != null) {
225                    this.delegate.checkExit( status );
226                }
227
228                throw new ExitException(status);
229            }
230
231        }
232
233        /**
234         * An exception that is thrown when the the main method calls {@link System#exit(int)}.  This lets us capture
235         * the exit code without the VM actually exiting.
236         */
237        private static class ExitException extends SecurityException
238        {
239            private final int exitCode;
240
241            public ExitException( int exitCode )
242            {
243                this.exitCode = exitCode;
244            }
245
246            public int getExitCode()
247            {
248                return exitCode;
249            }
250        }
251    }
252}
